name: Access control
description: Hub administrators can [control over who has access to your hub](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/admin/howto/manage-users.html)

name: GitHub Logon
description: Authenticate with a list of GitHub usernames

name: Google OAuth logon
description: Authenticate with email addresses that use Google OAuthentication

name: GitHub Teams Logon
description: Authenticate via membership in a GitHub Team that you control

name: Custom user environment
description: Communities may [bring their own Docker images](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/admin/howto/environment/index.html) for user environments.

name: Host content in repositories
description: Use [nbgitpuller](https://jupyterhub.github.io/nbgitpuller/) to store content in online repositories and [distribute them to users with a click](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/admin/howto/content.html)

name: Jupyter Interfaces
description: Jupyter Lab and Notebook interfaces are designed for interactive data science environments

name: RStudio
description: RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R

name: User storage
description: Users have their own filesystem that persists between sessions.

name: Configurable RAM
description: Configure the RAM available to users from the hub UI

name: Configurable CPU
description: Configure the CPU available to users from the hub UI

name: Shared storage
description: Administrators can place files in a shared folder that all users may access.

name: Use commercial cloud
description: Hubs can run on either AWS, GKE, or Azure

name: Connect with cloud data
description: Access cloud-hosted [data from your hub](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/admin/howto/data.html)

name: Scalable Dask Clusters
description: Scale your computing with Dask Gateway clusters

name: Bring your own credits
description: Communities can run 2i2c Hubs on [*their* cloud accounts and projects.](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/admin/howto/create-billing-account.html#)

name: Operations Support
description: 2i2c provides a [dedicated support channel](https://docs.2i2c.org/en/latest/support.html) for all hubs

name: Hub Uptime
description: 2i2c has a team of Hub Engineers that keep the infrastructure up-to-date, upgraded, and running smoothly

name: User Privacy
description: Hubs follow best practices in user privacy, and 2i2c retains no user data.

name: Connect with communities
description: 2i2c provides a communications channel in Slack for Community Representatives to connect with one another

name: Right to Replicate
description: Hubs are designed to be [replicable by anybody](https://2i2c.org/right-to-replicate) on their own infrastructure.

name: Open Source Stack
description: Hubs are built entirely with open source and community-driven tooling

name: Open Source Support
description: Hub fees fund open source engineers to do development and community work across the stack.
